* 401K Plan
* PTO (Vacation, Sick, Bereavement, Go 2 Days)

* Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands, and deal with change, delays, or unexpected events
* Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner; gather and analyze information skillfully

Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia, Westchester Counties and New York City. Sun River Health is currently seeking a Certified Housing Counselor and Program Event Support. This position will be full-time based in Peekskill and Tarrytown, NY with a hybrid working option. The standard scheduled is Monday through Friday 9a-5p with weekend and evening flexibility as needed for events. Must have reliable transportation and flexible schedule.  



**Position Summary:** The HUD Certified Housing Counselor is responsible for working with clients one-on-one to coach and motivate them to achieve their goals for housing stability and financial opportunity with money management, credit, rental, home ownership, and foreclosure counseling. This position also conducts financial education and homebuyer education classes. Per HUD guidelines, the Housing Counselor will be responsible for creating action plans, complying with HUD reporting requirements, and maintaining certification. The Housing Counselor will assist The Preservation Company with advocacy within the community, join local events, and develop relationships within the various communities served. This role will support the program and assist with all daily administrative functions required for program success. Additionally, this role will support organization-wide events and hosted programs. Event support will include event planning and organization, vendor communications, marketing and promotion of events, and management on site during events.  



**Responsibilities of Counselor:**

* Currently be a HUD Certified Housing Counselor; must maintain certification in good standing.
* Meets individually with clients to provide financial coaching and housing counseling, using HUD’s Housing Counseling Rules and Regulations as a guide.
* Performs homebuyer client intake, counseling, and follow-up on spending plan, credit, savings, and home purchase and financing process.
* In accordance with HUD guidelines for Default and Foreclosure Counseling, performs default client intake, counseling, and follow-up on spending plan, credit, and savings.
* Advocate for clients in various housing programs; be aware of various local projects and access points for clients.
* Using HUD certified client management system, will maintain all records, updating files as needed, and ensure timely reporting. All reports must be submitted by deadline.
* Provide clients with necessary education such as budgeting, grocery lists, and list of social services available.
* Cultivate and maintain relationships with referral agencies, community leaders and community organizations.
* Provide support in achieving all grant deliverables and tasks
* Assist with designing flyers, education material, and event plans and programs.
* Participate in local fairs, events, and tabling.

Act as an administrative support to the ED and leadership of the Preservation Company, including managing phones and emails, performing mail merges and mailings, writing and submitting minutes, etc.

* Must be comfortable mixing acid or bicarb

**Bierman Autism Centers is looking for a full-time & center-based Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to join a motivated and energetic team focused on transforming the lives of children diagnosed with autism while building a fun and creative culture at work! Our one-on-one approach is focused on natural play to teach foundational skills our kids can build on, such as self-advocacy and communication. Every child’s success is unique! We continually challenge ourselves to do anything it takes to enable our kids to reach their potential on their terms.**

**Position Description:**


The Behavior Analyst (BA) has a primary responsibility to accelerate client success through the direct oversight and care of client programming for a caseload of clients. By maintaining a caseload of approximately 7 clients in their assigned location, the BA will ensure oversight of clinical quality, prescription fulfillment, ethical practice, and client outcomes. As a leader and model for RBTs and other BAs, the BA takes on the responsibility of upholding the organization’s core values, cultivating a culture of integrity, creativity, respect, teamwork, and excellence within their center.


Qualified candidates will enjoy working with children, demonstrate excellent communication skills, be well organized, flexible, patient, and dependable. They will be highly motivated, naturally take initiative, be willing to learn, remain curious, and look to make a larger, positive impact.

**Why Become a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) at Bierman?**

* **Full Time Hours:** Our centers are open **Monday – Friday: 8:15am – 4:45pm. No travel required!**
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Offered for full-time employees. This includes: **Flexible Discretionary Time Off:** ***Take time off as needed (we mean it!)*****.** Instead of providing a bank of specified PTO hours we provide the trust and flexibility to take personal / vacation days as you need them!! Holiday Pay, 401k, Health, Dental and Vision Insurance, Short- and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Pet Insurance, HSAs, FSAs, and so much more!
* **Competitive Pay:** Pay is based on candidate qualifications and experience.
* **Growth and Advancement Opportunities:** We host on-site trainings, student supervision, tuition reimbursement, and student loan assistance, career path opportunities and more.
* **Be a Part of a Great Team:** You’ll be part of a passionate, empathetic, and supportive team. We host optional engagement events throughout the year such as Spirit Weeks, Pajama Days, Trivia Nights, Monthly Wellness Competitions and more!
* **Clinical Documentation Remote Work Day**: Monthly opportunity to work from home and focus on clinical documentation!

**What happens after I apply?**


You will be invited to have a 1:1 virtual interview with a recruiter. After this, you will have the opportunity to speak with our clinical team and meet with them in person in one of our centers! We want you to have the opportunity to see us in action – we’re not just interviewing you, you get to interview us!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Meet prescription fulfillment goals as assigned by Clinical Director
* Required to meet both hourly and monthly authorization fulfillment equaling an average of 25 billable hours per week
* Required to conduct parent training/caregiver collaboration in both the clinic and home setting (if appropriate)
* Maintain relationships with parents of current clients and conduct caregiver collaboration and training sessions as assigned with a minimum of 1 parent training per client per month
* Ensures client programming is ethical, appropriately individualized, and provided with integrity by making consistent programming decisions for assigned clients and conducting overlaps with clients and behavior technicians
* Ensure oversight of programming implement in both the center based setting and community settings (if applicable)
* Design and implement Treatment Plans (TP) for assigned clients
* Update progress reports for assigned clients
* Oversee/monitor ABA programs including conducting initial and ongoing assessments
* Direct, lead & supervise behavior technicians as part of managing programs, including oversight of assigned RBT supervision hours
* Keep up to date on current research and best practices
* Model and fill in for therapy as needed
* Promote Bierman Autism Centers within the community
* Assist Clinical Directors with conducting Initial Assessments as needed
* Take on assigned supervisees for BACB student supervision as needed
* Assist with Interim Care as needed for potential clients as needed
* Properly document all activities according to both the BACB guidelines and funder guidelines


Requirements:
**Basic & Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to lift and carry clients who are least 30 pounds
* Must be willing and able to restrain/hold/transport and utilize quick body movements as indicated in the Behavior Support Plan in the course of working with children with challenging behavior
* Must be able to assume and maintain a variety of postures including kneeling, squatting, crouching, crawling, sitting, standing, bending, for extended periods of time.
* Must be able to walk and run to chase clients and maintain a three-foot distance at all times
* Must be able to sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time
* Must be able to attend to basic needs such as feeding, diapering, toileting, and dressing
* Must have manual dexterity to perform specific computer and electronic device functions for data collection
* Must have visual acuity to read and comprehend written communication through computer, electronic devices, and paper means.
* Must be able to take written data and transfer to electronic files or data base systems
* Must be able to maintain prolonged periods of working on a computer while sitting at a desk or on the floor
* Must be able to assemble, clean and maintain therapy space including toys and furniture
* Must be able to administer medication to clients

**Job Requirements:**

* BCBA or BCBA-D Certification.
* Licensure in states of practice (where applicable).
* Strong organization, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
* Clinical experience in early intervention, precision teaching, and behavior reduction preferred
* Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams
* Excellent written and oral communication with colleagues, direct reports, and caregivers.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
* Must be detail oriented.
* Be flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of the team across the organization.
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Must have knowledge of MacOS and be comfortable operating in a primarily Mac OS environment.
* Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s technology platforms including CentralReach and Tableau.
* Ability to maintain required licensure to practice while employed.

description:

Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

  

As a leading mountain resort operator with 42 resorts in sixteen states and four countries, we exist to create an Experience of a Lifetime for our employees, so they can, in turn, provide an Experience of a Lifetime for our guests. We are looking for leaders, innovators, creators, and ambitious professionals to join our talented team. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you!


Many of our Corporate function teams can now live and work in any of the states in which Vail Resorts currently operates\\* – enabling flexible remote work alongside a commitment to building and maintaining strong culture both in person and virtually. Find your purpose with us at www.vailresortscareers.com.

  

The Vail Resorts Procurement Team is committed to Building Leaders and Driving Value. We are creating a world class procurement organization in our corporate headquarters to support a growing company of 42 resorts, 55,000+ employees and a market capitalization of over $10 billion. We are transforming our procurement organization to bring best-in-class category management, sourcing, vendor management, and procurement tools to enable data-driven decision making at Vail Resorts – the ski industry’s global leader.

  

Our team will be driven by top-tier talent, state-of-the-art systems and tools, and strategic process management to identify and deliver against the Company’s biggest supply chain value opportunities. We are creating a sustainable high-performing team that will develop talent and prioritize career growth through accelerated opportunities and progression. This is an opportunity to join the Procurement team at a critical inflection point and shape how we create value into the future.

 **Job Summary:**


The Procurement Operations Analyst is accountable for driving value through focusing on procurement compliance, supplier onboarding, buyer/supplier support, catalog management, user training, and process improvement This role reports to the Procurement Operations & Advancement Manager and is eligible for Remote\\* work. The Procurement Operations Analyst plays an integral role as the Procurement Operations team undergoes a change to a scalable operating model as we expand globally. This role will have the opportunity to help our stakeholders achieve their desired business results by enabling a seamless Procure-to-Pay (P2P) experience. * Identify key areas in which the P2P process can be improved through utilization of existing and potential new technologies.
* Assist in the implementation of new functionality to support an improved P2P experience for both Vail Resorts employees and suppliers
* Analyze user behavior to identify key needs for training, and improvements in system functionality to create a seamless experience. Continually seek and recommend process and system improvements aligned to strategic objectives.
* Participate in user acceptance testing for various technology system enhancements to ensure that Coupa updates do not affect functional use.
* Serve as a point of operational support and escalation, including providing system and process troubleshooting support
* Provide transactional buyer/supplier support, including evaluating and approving new supplier setups, purchasing requests, conducting user training, and email/support tickets
* Perform root cause analysis, using data insights, to drive process compliance improvements across the Source to Pay function with minimal manager direction
* Coordinate with corporate-wide, cross-functional teams to address the need for changes to processes, policies, and procedures

 **Job Requirements:**

* 2+ years work related experience
* Coupa experience is a must
* Aptitude for learning processes, technologies and systems, both internal and external
* Solid understanding of MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams etc.)
* Able to work autonomously balancing multiple projects while providing a high level of customer support
* Ability to demonstrate learning agility and thought-leadership as business needs change and increase in complexity
* Curious, with a passion for understanding “the why” in order to continuously improve
* Analytical skills, time management skills, and strong interpersonal communication
* Self-starter; ability to work independently
* Keen eye for finding opportunities, defining a problem space, and implementing a solution
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills linking issue resolution to operational improvement
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of employees and 3rd parties required

 **Preferred:**

* Exposure to Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Strategic Sourcing, or related fields preferred
* B.A. or B.S. in Business, Finance, Supply-Chain, Economics, or related field; relevant work experience also accepted in lieu of education requirements
* Strong Data and Analytics skills
* Process analysis, design, and implementation experience

  

The expected Total Compensation for this role is $55,000 - $69,575. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

* MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, and mountain shuttles

Full Time roles are eligible for the above, plus:
